body:
Refactor the logic on how to identify the root_dir for gopls. 

This will provide a viable solution to the issue where multiple gopls lsp client instances are started, causing adverse effects in certain areas like diagnostics, lsp functionality (such as `go to definition`, workspace-enabled projects).

The identification for required directories are based on golang-specific environment variables which are set by default.

comment_data.body:
what happens if `output.stdout` is nil? should it be like this, so that an error is shown ?  
```suggestion
    if output.code == 0 and output.stdout then
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,13 +4,82 @@
 ---
 --- Google's lsp server for golang.
 
+--- @class go_dir_custom_args
+---
+--- @field envvar_id string
+---
+--- @field custom_subdir string?
+
 local mod_cache = nil
+local std_lib = nil
+
+---@param custom_args go_dir_custom_args
+---@param on_complete fun(dir: string | nil)
+local function identify_go_dir(custom_args, on_complete)
+  local cmd = { 'go', 'env', custom_args.envvar_id }
+  vim.system(cmd, { text = true }, function(output)
+    if output.code == 0 then
+      if output.stdout then

comment_data.body:
yes, the nested if can be put together. `GOMODCACHE` and `GOROOT` will always be set in a system where go is installed.

So the only situation I can think of where `output.stdout` is empty would be in a system without go installed.

Though, on my system `output.stdout` is never `nil`, its just an empty string when I pass in a non-existing env var, e.g. `GOBLABLA`. I suggest to rewrite to

```
    if output.code == 0 and output.stdout and output.stdout ~= "" then
```

It is a bit verbose but catches all non-happy paths.

+      local res = vim.trim(output.stdout)
+      if custom_args.custom_subdir and custom_args.custom_subdir ~= '' then
+        res = res .. custom_args.custom_subdir
+      end
+      on_complete(res)
+    else
+      vim.schedule(function() end)

comment_data.body:
nit
```suggestion
    local res = vim.trim(output.stdout or '')
    if output.code == 0 and res ~= '' then
```

comment_data.body: sorry, the notify should have been wrapped by the schedule function. Fixing this.

comment_data.body: FYI if a dir is NOT found, it's generally best to NOT call `on_dir`. Otherwise the config will be activated even if `workspace_required=true`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -23,23 +90,9 @@ return {
   filetypes = { 'go', 'gomod', 'gowork', 'gotmpl' },
   root_dir = function(bufnr, on_dir)
     local fname = vim.api.nvim_buf_get_name(bufnr)
+    get_mod_cache_dir()
+    get_std_lib_dir()
     -- see: https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/issues/804
-    if mod_cache then
-      on_dir(get_root(fname))
-      return
-    end
-    local cmd = { 'go', 'env', 'GOMODCACHE' }
-    vim.system(cmd, { text = true }, function(output)
-      if output.code == 0 then
-        if output.stdout then
-          mod_cache = vim.trim(output.stdout)
-        end
-        on_dir(get_root(fname))
-      else
-        vim.schedule(function()
-          vim.notify(('[gopls] cmd failed with code %d: %s\n%s'):format(output.code, cmd, output.stderr))
-        end)
-      end
-    end)
+    on_dir(get_root_dir(fname))

comment_data.body: this is a race, but I guess the main "risk" is that `identify_go_dir` could run multiple times, which seems acceptable. though, that means it could show redundant errors...
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,13 +4,80 @@
 ---
 --- Google's lsp server for golang.
 
+--- @class go_dir_custom_args
+---
+--- @field envvar_id string
+---
+--- @field custom_subdir string?
+
 local mod_cache = nil
+local std_lib = nil
+
+---@param custom_args go_dir_custom_args
+---@param on_complete fun(dir: string | nil)
+local function identify_go_dir(custom_args, on_complete)
+  local cmd = { 'go', 'env', custom_args.envvar_id }
+  vim.system(cmd, { text = true }, function(output)
+    local res = vim.trim(output.stdout or '')
+    if output.code == 0 and res ~= '' then
+      if custom_args.custom_subdir and custom_args.custom_subdir ~= '' then
+        res = res .. custom_args.custom_subdir
+      end
+      on_complete(res)
+    else
+      vim.schedule(function()
+        vim.notify(
+          ('[gopls] identify ' .. custom_args.envvar_id .. ' dir cmd failed with code %d: %s\n%s'):format(
+            output.code,
+            vim.inspect(cmd),
+            output.stderr
+          )
+        )
+      end)
+      on_complete(nil)
+    end
+  end)
+end
+
+---@return string?
+local function get_std_lib_dir()
+  if std_lib and std_lib ~= '' then
+    return std_lib

comment_regular_data.body: thanks! ideally this would be much less code, but i don't see any obvious ways to do that.

> thanks! ideally this would be much less code, but i don't see any obvious ways to do that.

I agree, I tried to de-duplicate as much as possible / where it makes sense. Hopefully it is not a problem.

title: feat(gopls): refactor root_dir identification #3940
